task_description: Add comprehensive error handling and user feedback infrastructure to frontend application to address silent API failures

patterns.toast_provider: React Context API pattern for global state management - create context, provider component with useState, and custom hook for accessing context
patterns.error_handling: try-catch-finally pattern in async functions - catch errors, log to console (debugging), show user-friendly toast (UX), reset loading state in finally block
patterns.axios_interceptor: Response interceptor pattern for global error handling - intercept all responses, check status codes, handle authentication failures centrally
patterns.mui_components: Material-UI Snackbar + Alert components for notifications - Snackbar for positioning/timing, Alert for severity styling (error/success/warning/info)

existing_implementations.description: ToastProvider already implemented using MUI Snackbar and React Context API. Applied to 9 page components with consistent error/success feedback. 401 interceptor implemented in axios client.
key_insights: ToastProvider uses Context API with 5 methods: showToast, showError, showSuccess, showInfo, showWarning
All page components destructure { showError, showSuccess } from useToast() hook
Error messages are user-friendly (e.g., 'Failed to load projects. Please try again.') not technical
Success messages provide positive feedback (e.g., 'Project created successfully!')
401 interceptor checks if URL includes '/auth/' to prevent redirect loops on login/register endpoints
Toast auto-dismisses after 5000ms, positioned bottom-right using anchorOrigin prop
MUI Alert component uses 'filled' variant for better visibility
